body_html:
Thanks for the fix. But my question is: Why not have torch.backends.cudnn.deterministic = True by default? I noticed that I got non-deterministic results and it took some effort to dig up this solution. Imagine someone who doesn't know about this and run some expensive simulations for research only to have results not reproducible.
I feel that torch.backends.cudnn.deterministic should at least be set to True automatically whenever torch.cuda.manual_seed() is called, because determinism is the point of setting seed. From my testing, torch.backends.cudnn.deterministic = True doesn't noticeably slow down the performance, so are there reasons that we don't want the default to be True? Thanks!

body:
Thanks for the fix. But my question is: Why not have `torch.backends.cudnn.deterministic = True` by default? I noticed that I got non-deterministic results and it took some effort to dig up this solution. Imagine someone who doesn't know about this and run some expensive simulations for research only to have results not reproducible. 
I feel that `torch.backends.cudnn.deterministic` should at least be set to `True` automatically whenever `torch.cuda.manual_seed()` is called, because determinism is the point of setting seed. From my testing, `torch.backends.cudnn.deterministic = True` doesn't noticeably slow down the performance, so are there reasons that we don't want the default to be `True`? Thanks!
